thread.title: Best Web videos: Pumpkin spice latte revealed
thread.title_full: Best Web videos: Pumpkin spice latte revealed

title: Best Web videos: Pumpkin spice latte revealed
text:
A video from the Verge examines how filmmakers use color to manipulate emotions. (Photo: youtube.com/theverge)
6 CONNECT 33 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Here's a recap of some of the best videos that graced the Internet this week. There's an honest look at Jurassic World and pumpkin spice lattes, a compilation of movie outtakes that made it to the big screen and a documentary short on the greatest comic-book movie that never was. Take a break from whatever you're doing and watch the five best videos of the week.
How filmmakers manipulate our emotions using color
Blue for horror, green for sci-fi and red for comedy. The Verge takes a look at how filmmakers use color to enhance or manipulate the audience's emotions.
Honest Trailers - Jurassic World
"Welcome to Jurassic World , an awesome dinosaur version of Sea World." The Jurassic Park sequel is the latest movie to get the honest trailer treatment from the folks at the Screen Junkies YouTube channel.
10 Movie Outtakes That Made It To The Big Screen
The Screen Rant YouTube channel finds all the bloopers and outtakes that sneaked through to the big screen. A seven-minute video highlights Hollywood's biggest blunders, like when Luke Skywalker mistakenly called Princess Leia "Carrie" or when Chris Pratt drops an all-powerful orb in Guardians of the Galaxy .
MORE : Web to Watch top picks
What's Really in a Pumpkin Spice Latte
The leaves on the trees are starting to change, which means it's pumpkin spice latte season. The folks at the Sci Show YouTube channel examine the ingredients of everybody's favorite fall beverage.
I Thought I Told You To Shut Up!!
Here's the story behind the greatest comic-book movie that never was. In 1977, David Boswell created the beloved comic-book character Reid Fleming, the World's Toughest Milkman. Jack Nicholson and Robin Williams were rumored to star in the movie adaptation but, thirty years later, the project remains in development limbo. A fascinating documentary short narrated by Jonathan Demme and directed by Charlie Tyrell chronicles the rise and fall of Reid Fleming.
6 CONNECT 33 TWEET LINKEDIN //usat.ly/1Lz1TfL TOP VIDEOS
